data.title: Fixed JavaDoc typo
data.body: Today is "JavaDoc typo"-day!

data.title: Added a VirtualViewport utility
data.body:
I added a VirtualViewport to help with keeping the aspect ratio and handling a fixed viewport size. Basically letterboxing. I see many people asking how to handle different aspect ratios and in the end implementing something similar to this, based on the letterbox tests.

That's why I thought adding something like this to gdx itself might help people. What do you guys think?

data.title: LwjglGraphics, make display modes list permanent
data.body: getDisplayModes basically works very slow (need about 2-3 seconds). Don't know what exactly make is slow (i think it's on lwjgl side), but this solution works fine and faster than before.

data.title: ProgressBar knobBefore & knobAfter ignore background NinePatch paddning
Small Android Backend Cleanup
data.body:
- Removed SingleTouchHandler, multitouch lives on.
- Fixed a little deprecation I missed in AndroidInput
- Removed some unused imports

data.title: Gdx-Setup-UI: Android SDK minimum is now 8
data.body: We dropped support for versions < 2.2 (8).

data.title: Updated all Android demos to 4.4
data.body:
We dropped support for pre-2.2, set minimum SDK version to 8 to avoid
crashes

data.title: iOS - Viewport stretched - possibly related to bug #1407
[gdx-jnigen] Loading libraries without postfix
data.body:
I'm using gdx-jnigen in some projects I work on, and I have some library dependencies which I would like to pack in the same jar file, something I did before already. However, this time, the libraries I have to use are not postfixed with 64 for the 64-bit version.
This gives 2 problems:
1. Name clashes occur for the dependencies for each platform.
2. The jnigen libloader refuses to load the 64 bit versions, since they don't have the postfix.

I can't change the names of the dependencies, since the resolvement of dependencies on windows fails when I do.

The first problem is solvable by adding subdirectories which represent the different platforms and architectures. However, the second problems is not solvable at the moment. When solving the first problem, the second one becomes more complicated.

My suggestion is to add a "libfinder", which would be an interface that can be implemented by the user, and supply that to the libloader, which would then use this libfinder to find the libraries for the given platform. The default searchpaths would stay the same as they are now, while providing a way for the developers to use more advanced structures.

I would be willing to implement this, but I would first like to know if there is some other way to get this done. Also I would like to know your opinions on this...

data.title: Resolve 'collision.com.badlogic.gdx.physics.bullet.collision' issue
data.body:
Source is generated into the collision subdirectory, so jni/swig-src/collision must be added to the maven add-source plugin so that IDEs import the source from the correct root.

With eclipse m2e you'll need to 'Maven->Update Project...' to see the correction work.

data.title: Added skipPngCrush to the robovm.xml generator
data.body: Without skipPngCrush enabled in robovm.xml, any .png assets will be made unusable by LibGDX when run on iOS.

data.title: Separate nine-patch for Window's titlebar
data.body: scene2d.ui.Window should use a separate nine-patch for the titlebar. This way the titlebar doesn't have to be a part of the background drawable nine-patch which doesn't allow dynamic scaling of the titlebar depending on the font size of the title for example.

data.title: AssetManager expose Logger
data.body:
Logger that's part of AssetManager should be either protected or have a setter method. 

What I'm hoping to do is wire up that logger to the loading screen in form and show it either as text or a loading bar.

data.title: Use correct package in AndroidManifest.xml
data.body: Used %PACKAGE% in manifest package

data.title: Renaming variables for codebase consistency
data.body:
Ι've been working on a research machine learning-based tool (link: http://groups.inf.ed.ac.uk/naturalize/ ) tool that analyzes source code identifiers and makes suggestions for renaming them. The goal is to reduce unnecessary diversity in variable naming and improve code readability. This pull request is only a small sample of the suggestions made for libgdx.

No functional changes were made in any of the commits.

data.title: [RoboVM] Out of memory when loading large images
data.body:
We have been working on a game targeting iOS and Android both phones and tablets.

To support higher resolution screens we are packaging some of our images at 1080x1920. Currently we have 9 such images. We are also trying to use mipmaps to support various screen resolutions. To do that we are packaging the images into 2048x2048 atlases. (We tried 4096x4096 atlases as well)

Everything works perfectly on Desktop, Android and iPad and iPod simulator. However, when deploying to the latest iPod Touch the app crashes with a signal 9 exit code. Reading up on that error code turned out to be an out of memory issue. After enabling debug logging on AssetManager, the culprit seems to be the loading of 2048x2048 textures. The app does okay with 2-3 of them, but more than that blows the memory past 1GB mark at which point the app throws a signal 9.

The work around that we are currently using for an alpha release of the game is to scale the images down to half the size, 540x960, which only requires two 2048x2048 atlas images. This allows to load the game on the device and runs at a consistent 230mb of RAM or so. The Desktop version of the game in comparison runs at about 30mb of RAM according to JProfiler.

We have tried playing around with various other atlas packaging settings like turning off mipmaps, reducing the JPG quality, getting rid of transparency, but nothing seems to help. 

Just an FYI, the images total about 2.1mb on disk as compressed jpg and about 40mb as uncompressed png.

Seems like the issue is a memory leak. Perhaps a more aggressive garbage collection schema would do the trick here, not sure how to trigger that manually.

data.title: Added missing buildscript snapshot repository required for GDX-Tools resolution
data.body:
Build script was failing due to not finding '**com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-tools:1.0-SNAPSHOT**'. This was because the buildscript-related section of **build.gradle** did not reference the snapshots repository @ https://oss.sonatype.org/content/repositories/snapshots/.

See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/1396

data.title: Button Background not visible
data.body: Updated to latest nightly build yesterday. Since then Button backgrounds are not shown when set with button.setBackground or button.background.

data.title: Gradle build broken
data.body:
I think b431387 breaks the Gradle configuration generated by `gdx-setup.jar`. I get:

```
[mckinlay@dev1 mygame]$ ./gradlew

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
A problem occurred configuring root project 'mygame'.
> Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':classpath'.
   > Could not find com.badlogicgames.gdx:gdx-tools:1.0-SNAPSHOT.
     Required by:
         :mygame:unspecified

* Try:
Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.

BUILD FAILED

Total time: 7.915 secs
```

Seems like a repository is missing.
